MAIN_MESSAGE: There is a power cut in the ML11 postcode area of Lesmahagow, affecting properties in Briar Bank and surrounding areas. We did not know in advance there would be a power cut, and are working to get supplies restored. So far we have identified that the fuses have blown at the Boughden Wood Substation this is due to a complex underground cable fault and we are still working to locate the fault location and we now expect your supply to be restored by 8.00pm. We understand that being without power is frustrating and please be assured we will restore your supply as soon as we possibly can. If for any reason this information changes then we will update this message. We apologise for the inconvenience and thank you for your patience. This message was updated at 3.30pm on Wednesday, 14 October 2020
